For a person who acts carelessly,
craving grows like a mÄluva creeper.
He wanders from birth to birth,
like a monkey in the forest seeking fruit.
Whatever this born being endures,
craving, which spreads in the world,
his sorrows increase,
like spreading grass.
But whoever endures this born being,
craving, which is hard to overcome in the world,
his sorrows fall away from him,
like water drops from a lotus.
I tell you this for your welfare,
